snippet: In a country where abortion is entirely illegal, volunteers who answer calls at a hot line that tries to help women face possible prison sentences.
abstract: Chile's Safe Abortion Hot Line, which began in 2009 and is run by volunteers, provides callers with information about use of misoprostol, drug that will induce medical abortion; volunteers, operating in legal gray area in country where all abortions are illegal, face daunting prison sentence if conversation veers from lawyer-approved script and appears to offer more than information.
lead_paragraph: In a country where abortion is entirely illegal, volunteers who answer calls at a hot line that tries to help women face possible prison sentences.

headline.seo: In Chile, Abortion Hot Line Is in Legal Gray Area
headline.main: Taking Calls on Abortion, and Risks, in Chile
headline.print_headline: Taking Calls On Abortion, And Risks, In Chile
